messages.title: IT'S A CONSERVATIVE MAJORITY OR A HUNG PARLIAMENT
messages.content: At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: £33.9 billion extra for the NHS -- and funding new hospitals, creating 50 million more appointments in GP practices and investing in cancer screening machines.
20,000 extra police officers -- with 1,369 for London in the first year. And making sure they have the powers to keep our streets safe.
More funding for every pupil in every school -- so every child gets a better education, no matter what.

mentions.tacticalSituation: London voters in fewer than a dozen seats could decide if Boris Johnson or Jeremy Corbyn is the next Prime Minister

issues.economy: Economic chaos -- with hikes in tax to pay for his eye-watering plans to put politicians in charge of rail, energy, water and postal services.
issues.education: By scrapping Ofsted and abolishing SATs tests. Keeping parents in the dark on their children’s progress and school safety. More funding for every pupil in every school -- so every child gets a better education, no matter what.
issues.health: £33.9 billion extra for the NHS -- and funding new hospitals, creating 50 million more appointments in GP practices and investing in cancer screening machines.
issues.lawCrime: 20,000 extra police officers -- with 1,369 for London in the first year. And making sure they have the powers to keep our streets safe.

contactInformation.address: 4 Matthew Parker Street, London, SW1H 9HQ and Paragon CC, Park House, 16-18 Finsbury Circus, London, EC2M 7EB

endorsements.endorsement: The Lib Dems have ruled out a coalition with the Conservatives. So a hung parliament means Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister. With five long years of gridlock and uncertainty.

quotes.text: London voters in fewer than a dozen seats could decide if Boris Johnson or Jeremy Corbyn is the next Prime Minister
Gap between Tories and Labour shrinks
SNP to back Labour government only with Scottish independence

examples: Economic chaos -- with hikes in tax to pay for his eye-watering plans to put politicians in charge of rail, energy, water and postal services.
20,000 extra police officers -- with 1,369 for London in the first year.
The Lib Dems have ruled out a coalition with the Conservatives. So a hung parliament means Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister. With five long years of gridlock and uncertainty.
Economic chaos -- with hikes in tax to pay for his eye-watering plans to put politicians in charge of rail, energy, water and postal services.
By scrapping Ofsted and abolishing SATs tests. Keeping parents in the dark on their children’s progress and school safety.
Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister. With five long years of gridlock and uncertainty.
